title: Hakalau Media: A Web application platform which promotes user generated archive
title_en: Hakalau Media: A Web application platform which promotes user generated archive
abstract: 本研究は利用者が生成するアーカイブ（UGA）を促進するウェブアプリケーション基盤を提案する研究である。 本研究はWikiベースのプラットフォームに年表表示とブラウザ上での3D表示や音声再生を組み込み、2004–2010年の履歴を表示する事例を2010年のサミットで運用した。
abstract_en: This study proposes a web application platform that promotes user-generated archives (UGA). This study integrated timeline display and in-browser 3D rendering with audio playback into a wiki-based platform and operated a timeline example showing 2004–2010 history at a 2010 summit.
positioning_summary: 本研究はユーザーが生成するアーカイブ（UGA）が従来のユーザー生成コンテンツ（UGC）と異なり長期保存と再利用を目的とする重要な対象であると位置づけている。 本研究はウェブ上でUGCが増加する一方で体系的な蓄積やアーカイブ化が不足しているという問題を扱い、UGAを長期保存と再利用の観点から強調している。
positioning_summary_en: This study positions user-generated archives (UGA) as distinct from user-generated content (UGC) because UGA focuses on long-term preservation and reuse. This study addresses the lack of systematic accumulation and archiving on the web despite increasing UGC and emphasizes UGA from the perspective of long-term preservation and reuse.
purpose_summary: 本研究の目的はコンテンツ作成者やコミュニティに向けてUGAの生成と保存を促進するウェブアプリケーション基盤を提案することである。 本研究はUGA生成と保存を促進するためにコンテンツ作成者とコミュニティを対象にした支援を行う基盤の設計と運用を目標としている。
purpose_summary_en: The purpose of this study is to propose a web application platform that promotes the creation and preservation of user-generated archives (UGA) for content creators and communities. This study aims to design and operate a platform that supports content creators and communities to facilitate UGA creation and preservation.
method_summary: 本研究はWikiベースのUGAプラットフォームを設計し、年表表示やブラウザ上での3D表示と音声再生の仕組みを組み込んだ実装を行った。 本研究は年表表示機能とブラウザで機能する3D描画API相当と音声データAPI相当を活用し、2004–2010年の履歴を表示する年表事例を2010年のサミットで運用した。
method_summary_en: This study designed a wiki-based UGA platform and implemented features such as timeline display and in-browser 3D rendering with audio playback. This study implemented a timeline feature and used in-browser 3D rendering API equivalents and audio data API equivalents, and operated a timeline example showing 2004–2010 history at a 2010 summit.

llm_explanations.justification: Wiki-based platform supporting communities and collaborative content creation.

rejected.reason: Education-oriented path; paper targets archives/platform, not education.
Redundant digital-archives path less directly aligned than chosen info-systems concept.
Multimedia content creation focuses on authoring, not platform/archiving emphasis.
Human-centered computing variant overlaps but information-systems framing is clearer.
Blogs-specific concept not representative of a wiki-based archival platform.

prompt.system: You are an expert indexer who assigns ACM CCS 2012 concepts to computing research papers. You will receive the paper's title, abstract, and structured summaries. Use only the provided candidate concepts. Select at most 3 concepts that best describe the paper. If none of the candidates fit, return an empty list.
prompt.user:
Year: 2010

Paper summary:
Title: Hakalau Media: A Web application platform which promotes user generated archive
Authors: Tomoko Hashida, Daisuke Akatsuka
Year: 2010
Abstract: This study proposes a web application platform that promotes user-generated archives (UGA). This study integrated timeline display and in-browser 3D rendering with audio playback into a wiki-based platform and operated a timeline example showing 2004–2010 history at a 2010 summit.
Positioning Summary: This study positions user-generated archives (UGA) as distinct from user-generated content (UGC) because UGA focuses on long-term preservation and reuse. This study addresses the lack of systematic accumulation and archiving on the web despite increasing UGC and emphasizes UGA from the perspective of long-term preservation and reuse.
Purpose Summary: The purpose of this study is to propose a web application platform that promotes the creation and preservation of user-generated archives (UGA) for content creators and communities. This study aims to design and operate a platform that supports content creators and communities to facilitate UGA creation and preservation.
Method Summary: This study designed a wiki-based UGA platform and implemented features such as timeline display and in-browser 3D rendering with audio playback. This study implemented a timeline feature and used in-browser 3D rendering API equivalents and audio data API equivalents, and operated a timeline example showing 2004–2010 history at a 2010 summit.

Respond with JSON using the following schema:
{
  "ccs": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "path": "concept path string",
      "confidence": "high|medium|low",
      "justification": "brief reason citing evidence from the paper summary"
    }
  ],
  "rejected": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "reason": "why it was excluded"
    }
  ]
}
Always use candidate IDs exactly as provided. Do not invent new concepts. Limit the array under "ccs" to at most 3 entries. Limit the array under "rejected" to at most 5 entries. Keep every justification or reason concise (no more than 120 characters).
